result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Moses Chisom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered all costs and surcharges that can be waived to be waived. Court ordered any mandatory costs and surcharges to be paid by 12/07/2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Moses Chisom

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj

Defendant Aaron Moses Chisom in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered all costs and surcharges that can be waived to be waived.  Court ordered any mandatory costs and surcharges to be paid  by 12-07-2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a  DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Defendant Aaron Moses Chisom in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Aaron Moses Chisom in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Aaron Moses Chisom in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron Moses Chisom
Current: 3330 N 17th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 07-31-2015)
Prior: 2974 N. 29th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court on July 15, 2015.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Aaron Moses Chisom in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Aaron Moses Chisom in court with attorney Terese M. Dick as friend of the court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Defendant found eligible for public defender representation.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond that was previously signed to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-07-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron Moses Chisom
Current: 2974 N. 29th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 04-28-2015)
Prior: 2974 N. 29th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Aaron Moses Chisom in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.24.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/28/15 @ 1:30 pm
